DOCNAME: CASE OF ZAKRIYEVA AND OTHERS v. RUSSIA
CONCLUSION: No violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Substantive aspect);Violation of Article 2 - Right to life (Procedural aspect)
JUDGES: Anatoly Kovler;Christos Rozakis;Dean Spielmann;Elisabeth Steiner;George Nicolaou;Giorgio Malinverni;Sverre Erik Jebens
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants are :
( CARDINAL ) ORG , who was born in DATE ;
( CARDINAL ) PERSON , who was born in DATE ;
( CARDINAL ) PERSON , who was born in DATE ;
( CARDINAL ) PERSON , who was born in DATE ;
( CARDINAL ) Mr PERSON , who was born in DATE ;
( CARDINAL ) PERSON , who was born in DATE ;
( CARDINAL ) Mr PERSON , who was born in DATE ; and
( CARDINAL) Mr PERSON , who was born in DATE .
The second applicant lives in the village of ORG , in GPE . The other applicants live in the village of PERSON , ORG , in GPE .

CARDINAL . The first applicant is the mother of the sixth , seventh and eighth applicants and of Mr PERSON , who was born in DATE . PERSON was married to the second applicant ; they are the parents of the third , fourth and fifth applicants .
CARDINAL . The applicants did not witness the disappearance of PERSON . The account below is based on statements by third parties submitted by the applicants .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON was visiting his aunt , PERSON . , in PERSON . At TIME , while driving a car in the direction of his home village , he was stopped by a group of armed men at a NORP military checkpoint near the village of PERSON . The servicemen ordered PERSON to get out of the car and then put him into CARDINAL of several armoured personnel carriers ( “ APCs ” ) parked next to the checkpoint . That ORG ’s registration number was covered with mud so that CARDINAL figures , “ CARDINAL ” and “ CARDINAL ” , out of CARDINAL were visible . Then all the APCs drove off in the direction of ORG .

CARDINAL . Meanwhile a rumour spread that NORP military units were carrying out a special operation on the outskirts of ORG . PERSON . was concerned for her nephew ’s safety and drove towards PERSON to meet him . Near the PERSON checkpoint she encountered a group of women who had witnessed PERSON abduction and told her about it . PERSON . drove to PERSON in pursuit of the APCs , which she eventually overtook and followed to the secured courtyard of the military commander ’s office of LOC of Grozny ( “ the PERSON military commander ’s office ” ) .
CARDINAL . DATE the applicants visited the PERSON military commander ’s office and enquired about PERSON whereabouts but received no information .

CARDINAL . NORP DATE the applicants were told by unknown persons that not all of the APCs had arrived at the PERSON military commander ’s office on DATE as CARDINAL of them had left the group and driven in the direction of LOC .
CARDINAL . The Government stated that on DATE unidentified persons in camouflage uniforms had kidnapped PERSON in the village of PERSON in LOC of PERSON in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the second applicant wrote to FAC ( “ LOC ) , an NGO based in GPE , informing it that her husband had been arrested by NORP servicemen and asking for its help in searching for him . On the same date lawyers from PERSON wrote to the PERSON prosecutor ’s office ( “ the city prosecutor ’s office ” ) requesting that criminal proceedings be instituted in respect of PERSON disappearance .
CARDINAL . On DATE the city prosecutor ’s office instituted an investigation into ORG disappearance under LAW ( aggravated kidnapping ) . The case file was assigned number DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the city prosecutor ’s office granted the first applicant victim status in the case .
CARDINAL . On DATE the city prosecutor ’s office suspended the investigation on the grounds that it had not been possible to identify those responsible for the crime .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant sent a letter to the prosecutor ’s office of GPE with a copy to the Special Envoy of the NORP President in GPE . She said that her son had been arrested by NORP servicemen in the course of a “ sweeping ” operation in the village of PERSON and taken away in an ORG . She requested that the crime be investigated .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG forwarded the first applicant ’s complaint to the military prosecutor ’s office of ORG ( “ the ORG prosecutor ’s office ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office of GPE resumed the investigation into PERSON kidnapping and informed the first applicant accordingly . They also invited her to send any further queries to the prosecutor ’s office of LOC of Grozny ( “ the district prosecutor ’s office ” ) .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG prosecutor ’s office forwarded the first applicant ’s complaint to the military prosecutor ’s office of military unit no . CARDINAL ( “ the unit prosecutor ’s office ” ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE the department of the interior of the Zavodskoy District of Grozny ( “ ROVD ” ) issued a certificate confirming that PERSON had been missing since DATE and that search case no . DATE was pending before the ROVD .

CARDINAL . On DATE the unit prosecutor ’s office informed the first applicant that an inquiry into ORG disappearance had established that her son had not been arrested in the course of “ sweeping ” operations on DATE . No implication of the NORP military in the crime had been established . They also noted that her complaint had been forwarded to the prosecutor ’s office of ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG for ORG informed the first applicant that her complaint had been forwarded to the prosecutor ’s office of GPE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the unit prosecutor ’s office forwarded the first applicant ’s complaint to the military commander of ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON requested the district prosecutor ’s office to inform them whether an investigation into PERSON kidnapping by NORP servicemen had been opened and what investigative measures , if any , had been taken . They also requested the investigators to interrogate certain witnesses of the crime .

CARDINAL . On DATE the prosecutor ’s office of GPE forwarded the first applicant ’s letter to the district prosecutor ’s office ordering that it be included in the investigation file in case no . DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the PERSON requested the district prosecutor ’s office to inform them of progress in the investigation in case no . DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant complained about her son ’s abduction to the city prosecutor ’s office .
CARDINAL . On DATE the city prosecutor ’s office instituted an investigation into PERSON abduction under LAW of LAW ( aggravated kidnapping ) . The case file was assigned number CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was granted victim status and questioned . She submitted that PERSON had resided in the village of PERSON . On DATE he had gone to LOC to visit his relative , PERSON . On DATE PERSON . had told the first applicant that DATE federal servicemen carrying out a “ sweeping ” security operation had checked PERSON identity papers and then let him go . He had then left for his home village . At TIME a woman had told PERSON . that unknown men in camouflage uniforms had apprehended a young man near a dam . To protect the young man , the woman had told the men that she was his mother . The men in camouflage uniforms had proved that that was not the case by showing her identity papers in the name of PERSON and left .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON was questioned as a witness . She stated that on DATE she had overheard an elderly lady saying that she had witnessed the arrest of a young man by federal servicemen . When the lady told the servicemen that the arrested man was her son , they had produced identity papers in the name of PERSON . The lady had also mentioned that she had seen an ORG with numbers “ CARDINAL ” and “ CARDINAL ” on a muddied registration number plate .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON . was questioned and stated that on DATE she had seen a large group of people at a bus stop being subjected to an identity check . Her nephew PERSON was among them . TIME he had come to her home , packed his belongings and gone home . DATE her sister , PERSON . , had told her that according to an unknown woman then nephew had been taken away by armed men in an ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr Kh . , PERSON father , was questioned . He said that on DATE his son had gone to the village of PERSON . On DATE PERSON . had informed him that earlier that day servicemen had checked his son ’s identity papers . PERSON . had been told that at TIME unidentified persons had taken a young man away in an ORG .

CARDINAL . On DATE Ms R.Yu . was questioned and stated that on DATE she , her son and PERSON . had been travelling on a bus , which had broken down and stopped near the dam in the village of GPE . Servicemen had taken PERSON . ’s son away for an identity check ; her sister had gone with them . On her return , her sister had told PERSON . that an acquaintance had informed her that their nephew PERSON had been arrested by unknown servicemen and taken away in an ORG in the direction of school no . CARDINAL in LOC of Grozny .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON . was again questioned . She stated that on DATE she and her sister PERSON . had been travelling on a bus which had broken down near the dam . She had approached a crowd standing at the bus stop , where servicemen were carrying out identity checks . Her nephew PERSON had been there . PERSON . had observed the servicemen checking his identity using a computer before returning his identity papers . TIME her nephew had returned to her house and then fallen asleep . PERSON . and her husband had driven back to the bus stop to give a lift to her sister who had been waiting by the bus . Her sister had shown them a piece of paper marked with the words “ PERSON ” which she explained an unknown woman had given her after saying that she had witnessed servicemen placing PERSON in an ORG and driving away . PERSON . had immediately asked servicemen standing near the dam about her nephew , but they had replied that they knew nothing about him .

CARDINAL . On DATE Mr PERSON . , PERSON . ’s husband , was questioned . He is said that in DATE his wife had told him that servicemen had arrested her nephew and taken him away in an ORG . On DATE he and his wife had gone to the village of GPE . They had overtaken a motorcade consisting of APCs and asked the servicemen about PERSON but they had given them no information . PERSON . had taken a look inside several APCs but found nobody there .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date PERSON was questioned . She stated that on DATE in the village of PERSON she had seen an ORG and servicemen standing next to it . She had looked into through the window of CARDINAL of the APCs and noticed a young man ; she had not seen his face . PERSON had asked the servicemen to let the young man go , claiming that he was her son . The servicemen had asked her the man ’s name and she had said “ ORG ” . CARDINAL of the servicemen had shown her identity papers in the name of PERSON . The ORG ’s registration number plate was covered in mud and illegible .
CARDINAL . On DATE the first applicant was questioned and submitted that her son had been kidnapped not on DATE , but on DATE .

CARDINAL . The Government stated that the investigating authorities had sent a number of queries to various ORG bodies and had taken other investigative measures , but did not specify what those measures had been . According to various law - enforcement agencies of GPE , no special operations had been carried out on DATE in the village of PERSON .

CARDINAL . The investigation failed to identify the perpetrators . The implication of any law - enforcement agencies in the crime had not been established . PERSON had not been prosecuted , arrested or placed in a temporary detention facility in GPE .

CARDINAL . The investigation had been suspended on several occasions for failure to identify the perpetrators and then resumed . The applicants had been duly informed of all decisions taken during the investigation , which was still pending under the supervision of ORG .

CARDINAL . Despite specific requests by ORG did not disclose any documents from the investigation file in case no . DATE . Relying on the information obtained from ORG , the ORG stated that the investigation was in progress and that disclosure of the documents would be in violation of LAW , since the file contained information of a military nature and personal data concerning the witnesses or other participants in the criminal proceedings .
CARDINAL . For a summary of the relevant domestic law see PERSON and PERSON GPE , no . CARDINAL , § CARDINAL , CARDINAL DATE .
